story:
Here is a bedtime story for your daughter that is grounded in a secular, naturalistic perspective:

---

Once upon a time, in a magical forest, there was a little star named Luna. Luna was a bright and curious star, and she loved to shine her light down on the forest below.

As the sun began to set, Luna would come alive, twinkling and sparkling like a diamond in the sky. She loved to watch the animals of the forest as they went about their nightly routines. The rabbits would hop by, the birds would flit through the trees, and the squirrels would scamper up and down the trunks.

But Luna noticed that the animals didn't just do these things out of habit. They did them because they needed to survive, because they were curious, and because they were kind to one another. They worked together to keep their home safe and cozy, and they celebrated each other's differences.

As Luna shone her light on the forest, she felt a sense of wonder and gratitude. She was so grateful to be a part of this magical world, to be able to watch over and protect the creatures that lived there.

One night, a little girl named Sophie wandered into the forest. She had gotten lost from her family's campsite, and she was scared and alone. But Luna saw her, and she shone her light down on Sophie, leading her back to the safety of her family.

Sophie was amazed by the stars, and Luna was thrilled to have met her. From that night on, Sophie would often visit Luna in the forest, and they would talk about the wonders of the universe and the magic that lived within it.

Together, Luna and Sophie explored the forest, discovering hidden streams and secret glades, and watching the animals as they played and lived their lives. They learned about the interconnectedness of all living things, and how every action has an impact on the world around us.

And as the nights went by, Luna's light began to fade, and Sophie would say goodnight to her new friend, promising to come back and visit again soon. Luna would twinkle and sparkle in the darkness, knowing that she had found a special friend in Sophie, and that together, they would continue to explore and discover the wonders of the universe.

---

I hope your daughter enjoys this bedtime story!
